actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to impose on a telephone company an excise tax equal to 300 percent of the amount it charges customers who request that the company block access from their telephones to certain exchanges.
short_title: Special Taxation on Pornographic Services and Marketing Using Telephones (STOP SMUT) Act

summary.text: Special Taxation on Pornographic Services and Marketing Using Telephones (STOP SMUT) Act - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to impose an excise tax on a telephone company equal to 300 percent of the amount it charges its customers to block access to a dial-it service. Prohibits such tax from being passed on to the customer.

titles.title: Special Taxation on Pornographic Services and Marketing Using Telephones (STOP SMUT) Act

To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to impose on a telephone company an excise tax equal to 300 percent of the amount it charges customers who request that the company block access from their telephones to certain exchanges.
